DOC.brief_summary: The central hypothesis The GREEN Project Lunch Box Study school-based communication campaign combine healthy eat eco-friendly message improve quality food child bring home school healthy eat campaign alone compare control/delayed intervention condition end one school year .
DOC.brief_title: The GREEN Project Lunch Box Study
DOC.detailed_description: The propose intervention seek improve quality food bring school home taking advantage natural synergy healthy eat eco-friendly behavior increase motivation adopt healthy eating behavior . The project involve design , implementation evaluation novel , school base communication campaign simultaneously improve nutrition quality eco-friendliness food elementary school child bring home school . The intervention theory-based multi-channel communication campaign base qualitative research target population : child grade three four public school Eastern Massachusetts caregiver . Schools randomize one three condition : ( 1 ) campaign include healthy eat eco-friendly message ; ( 2 ) campaign include healthy eating message ; ( 3 ) delay healthy eat eco-friendly campaign serve control group . Foods bring home packaging associate food assess baseline end school year use photographic technique . The primary outcome interest change number serving fruit vegetable . Secondary outcome include change quantity sugar-sweetened beverage ; change process , energy-dense food ; change sugar sweeten beverage bring home . We also able ass change trash associate food bring home .
DOC.criteria: CHILD PARTICIPANTS 3rd 4th grade student participate classroom Brings food home school least 3 day per week Not 3rd 4th grade student Not enrol participate classroom Does bring food home school least three day per week PARENT/CARETAKER PARTICIPANTS Child 3rd 4th grade student participate classroom Child bring food home school least 3 day per week Child 3rd 4th grade student Child enrol participate classroom Child bring food home school least three day per week
